Text: Adoption of Children Act 1949:  This legislation liberalised various rules concerning adoption.

Text: Adoption of Children Act 1949:  In addition, the legislation also rejected the notion, implied in the Children Act of 1926, that the mother had to know the identity of the adopter if she could reasonably give consent to adoption.
